thread.title: Everton line up shock move to replace Romelu Lukaku this summer
thread.title_full: Everton line up shock move to replace Romelu Lukaku this summer

title: Everton line up shock move to replace Romelu Lukaku this summer
text:
Everton FC via Getty Images 1 of 8 Click to reveal the best odds on Romelu Lukaku's next club according to SkyBet 
"I've made a long way until now but the road is still long and I know I have to improve and get better. I want to help Everton as much as I can, as well as the national team. I think a lot of stuff can be achieved. 
"Sometimes people will mistake things that I say but it's just ambition that I have; I want to win titles and trophies and I don't think people should take that as arrogance -- people should embrace it. 
"This is what footballers need to achieve if they want to become the best, and I think young kids need to learn that too." 
Larin, 21, was the first MLS draft pick in 2015 and was signed by expansion team Orlando City. GETTY Cyle Larin is on Everton's radar as Ronald Koeman considers Romelu Lukaku replacements 
He went on to score 17 goals in 27 games and won 2015 MLS Rookie of the Year. 
He followed that up with 14 goals last season and played in the MLS All Stars game against Arsenal. 
This season he already has three in two games and is now on Koeman's radar, according to The Sun . 
He is expected to cost around Â£2million but is also being watched by Benfica, Nottingham Forest and Brighton while Benfica and Sporting Lisbon monitored him previously. Related articles
